intro: Modecca cardiocarpa, commonly known as the heart-shaped gourd, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes other gourds and cucurbits. The plant produces large, heart-shaped fruits that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. Its leaves are broad and palmately lobed, and it has tendrils that help it climb. The flowers are typically yellow with five petals and are pollinated by insects.
